text: Seems to me that if the "principle conclusions" boiled down to "Nothing To See Here, Folks" then he would have been able to say that already.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
The GOP’s anti-intellectualism began with Sarah Palin, you say?

Umm, let me just mention these three initials: GWB.

Actually, it should be these three: RWR.

Wait: RMN.

Well... it started even earlier, with BMG. In fact, it — you know, get comfortable. This could take a while.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: (Yes, I know when Motown was founded.)
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
A temporary exhibit about Motown is headed to the LBJ Presidential Library & Museum.

I wonder if the new exhibit ignores records from before 1957, as the LBJ Library's permanent exhibit ignores Lyndon Johnson's Civil Rights record from before 1957.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: And that, of course, was the problem.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
How did @Slate choose those “prominent people“?

EDITOR 1: Let’s pick 24 men but only 4 women.

EDITOR 2: Reasonable... as long as 3 of the 4 are awful in general.

E1: Sure! Can 3/4ths of the men be awful, too?

E2: Or have no business being on the list?

E1: Or both?

E2: Done!
author: AnthonyJClark

text: While you were governor, SC had rates higher than the nation in preterm birth, low birthweight, and teen birth, and in deaths from cancer, heart disease, chronic lower respiratory disease, stroke, diabetes, kidney disease, septicemia, suicide, Alzheimer's, firearms, and homicide.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
No one I know personally who still supports Trump has more than a 7th-grade understanding of government or politics, and none personally benefits from his policies.

They’re all caught up in the rush, the thrill, of how what he says makes them feel. It’s literally a game to them.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: That’s an overly generous timeline.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
Now THAT is a well-deserved ratio. Well done, Twitterverse. 

Oh, and shame on you, @CNN @DanaBashCNN.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
Perhaps most importantly:

- @MarkKUpdegrove - who, while federal director of the LBJ Library, dropped the nonpartisanship pretense and significantly amped up the fact-ignoring, laudatory "legacy" exhibit/event content, carefully tending The Flame - now runs the LBJ Foundation.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
Consider:

- Longley was 1st historian to run LBJ Library

- It was without a director for a long time before he was hired, partly because NARA allows each library's private foundation to veto director candidates it disapproves

- @LBJFoundation fiercely protects The Legacy

AND
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
No one will comment on why Dr. Kyle Longley is out as federal director of @USNatArchives @LBJLibrary after only 8 months. Reading between the lines it could be a "personnel matter."

But I can't help but wonder if it might be a clash w/the @LBJFoundation.

https://www.statesman.com/news/20190317/exclusive-kyle-longley-is-out-as-director-of-lbj-library …
author: AnthonyJClark

text: He needed <help> to not hire someone?
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
.@AriFleischer claims George W. Bush never lied about WMD, and was just “faithfully reporting what the IC concluded.”

GWB not only lied about WMD, he JOKED about lying about it  — at the 2004 WHCD.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: The Sons of Anarchy legacy sequel where Jax survives, doubles his weight, and runs for mayor of Charming as a conservatarian looks awful.
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
"In many ways, it is my patriotism being impugned."

After rightly being called out for questioning, on the Floor, his opponents' patriotism, @newtgingrich employed a tactic his ethical & political inheritors still use: claim to be the victim.*

*See @TuckerCarlson, @JudgeJeanine
author: AnthonyJClark

text: #ButIWasTold
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
Even though budgets & appropriations are up in the air, my 2016 piece on how #nonprofits can successfully advocate for their issues, programs, and organizations is still relevant - and, I think, helpful.

Spoiler alert: it's about building relationships.
author: AnthonyJClark

author: AnthonyJClark

text:
#ProTip: if it ain't physical, it ain't an "impact."



And no, "impacted" is not "more serious" than "affected."

#GrammarTips
author: AnthonyJClark

text: I would convert it into a Class B RV and take it on the road, to as many interesting places and to meet as many interesting people as possible!
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
"He was so annoying when I had him."
[Expands comment section]

"He told us, like, facts and stuff. And had us read more facts and stuff. And then, gave us, like, tests on all that. Like, he actually expected us to remember. I am so serious right now. I can't even. So annoying."
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
More than two times is a problem.

You're in the mid-hundreds, I'd say.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: Full passage, from a campaign speech FDR delivered on the Thursday before Election Day, 1928, at Philipsburg Hall, Yonkers, New York:
author: AnthonyJClark

text:
"...in the Legislature in 1911...we put in...the great program of social reform, and we were called...Socialists...and you know, we laughed at it at the time. But as time has gone by we have worn that term of intended opprobrium with pride."

   – Franklin D. Roosevelt, 11/1/1928
author: AnthonyJClark

text: Good eye, kid.
author: AnthonyJClark

text: To #historians #archivists lamenting NARA's decisions on Obama records and to no longer support "traditional" presidential library model: what panels have you proposed to your organizations? What letters/petitions have you signed/circulated? What have you told your elected reps?
author: AnthonyJClark

text: A well-respected journalist turning down, blindly, the chance to break news because of something more important to him: protecting the legacy and legacy factory of a favorite president. Just a bit of what I’ve dealt with while trying to reform the presidential library system. 4/4
author: AnthonyJClark

text: His assistant asked him, and responded to me: he says that if the president in question was LBJ, he'll pass, because he loves LBJ, and wouldn't report anything negative about him or his presidential library or foundation, which he supports and with which he works closely. 3/4
author: AnthonyJClark

text: Before my book came out in 2015 I pitched a network political news host on the previously unreported big scoop - that a sitting president illegally grabbed military land to build his presidential library. I didn't reveal who at first, to keep it under wraps in case he passed. 2/4
author: AnthonyJClark

text: Our presidential library system is broken, but not for donors, presidents, or others who benefit. Here’s an example of how the support network works, especially for the political organizations that build and then exploit the libraries for their own and their parties' gain. 1/4
author: AnthonyJClark

text: Fantastic! Looking forward to watching this.
author: AnthonyJClark
